definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: A system of handwritten Chinese characters recognition based on feedback structure is constructed.
sentences.chinese: 构建一种基于反馈结构的手写体汉字识别系统。

sentences.english: Compare the first three letters with the last 'n'. That's a real cursive.
sentences.chinese: 把前面3个和最后一个相比较，没错，这才是手写体。

sentences.english: A novel recognition method called Active Discriminant Function (ADF) for handwriting recognition is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种新的基于主动判别函数的手写体识别方法。

sentences.english: The method of handwritten digit recognition based on written direction is adopted.
sentences.chinese: 采用了一种基于笔道方向的手写体数字识别的方法。

sentences.english: There are two forms of the Chinese phonetic alphabet, the cursive and the printed.
sentences.chinese: 汉语拼音字母有手写体和印刷体两种体式。

sentences.english: May not work in scripted events or large falls.
sentences.chinese: 在手写体的事件或大的秋天不可能工作。

sentences.english: Do not use any script fonts.

definition: Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
